UI_visible_response: "Little Pink" refers to a nationalist supporter of the Chinese Communist Party who expresses such views on the internet, often associated with a new wave of female-led cyber-nationalism in China1. The term became popular around 2016 and is considered a manufactured label used by various cyber groups to challenge nationalistic perspectives, particularly regarding Taiwan2. Additionally, it has been noted that the label "Little Pink" was invented, and gender played a role in how different cyber groups attempted to reframe its imagery4. This term gained further attention when Malaysian rapper Namewee's music upset some mainland Chinese "little pinks," leading to his work being banned in China5.
traffic_visible_response: "Little Pink" refers to a nationalist supporter of the Chinese Communist Party who expresses such views on the internet, often associated with a new wave of female-led cyber-nationalism in China [[1]]. The term became popular around 2016 and is considered a manufactured label used by various cyber groups to challenge nationalistic perspectives, particularly regarding Taiwan [[2]]. Additionally, it has been noted that the label "Little Pink" was invented, and gender played a role in how different cyber groups attempted to reframe its imagery [[4]]. This term gained further attention when Malaysian rapper Namewee's music upset some mainland Chinese "little pinks," leading to his work being banned in China [[5]].
